column5: RRTS I only sell the cheapest approx 25 pct of my total shares when it happens Hold the rest
RRTS by monster I mean over 25 pct
RRTS I always buy it back and more The monster single day runs drop every time and do not change anything long term
RRTS I see and understand the case for holding with no trading The occasional huge intraday runs are scanners and daytraders I sell some
RRTS very low volume
RRTS But Ill reiterate that it is a show me story now on the margins We have to see some progress in order to extrapolate it to normal
RRTS postsplit and if we pick up some additional sell side coverage the opportunity should become painfully clear to potential buyers
RRTS Pre split it probably is not showing up on institutional screens and there is no incentive for additional sell side coverage yet
RRTS In capital markets a mispricing can persist indefinitely if investors are not working on this and then act on their work by trading
RRTS It is likely not lost on Elliott that this is a cyclical business overall I would fully expect that they have taken this into account
RRTS Elliott is not a quarter to quarter shop theyre a fundamentally based activist investor
RRTS This would just create an even better entry point Elliott would not be part of that group
RRTS However a downturn remains the biggest risk as people thinking about pennies in this would likely blow out in a panic
RRTS I would also expect Ascent to be less cyclical overall which could further cushion the other segments
RRTS this is on a pure trucking trough multiple it ignores that in a sum of the parts the ascent segment is valued at a higher multiple
RRTS 058 equity value on 5 in a DT
RRTS If you think 6 is aggressive call it 5 still 100M EBITDA
RRTS backout 150M in debt or so and you have equity value of 690M On 939M shares you have 73 stock price pre split
RRTS If you slap a 7x trough multiple on that remember cyclical multiples are highest at the bottom youre looking at 840M EV
RRTS If you assume a 13 decline in top line to 2B even but they are still able to get margins to 6 that is still 120M in EBITDA
RRTS Guys to extend some of the comments about recessionary risk in my model I have assumed that they can still improve margins in a DT
